00020 
00021 #include "GameCodeStd.h"
00022 
00023 #define SLEEPTIME       0
00024 
00025 
00026 //========================================================================
00027 // define static variables
00028 //========================================================================
00029 static int      s_milliseconds;
00030 static __int64  s_ticks;
00031 
00032 static int      s_milliseconds0;
00033 static __int64  s_ticks0;
00034 
00035 //========================================================================
00036 // fabs
00037 //
00038 // floating point absolute value function
00039 //========================================================================
00040 #if 0
00041 #pragma message("Dsiabled local fabs()implementation to prevent collision w/impl in VS.NET 2k3")
00042 float inline fabs(float a)
00043 {
00044         if (a < 0.0f)
00045                 return -a;
00046         else
00047                 return a;
00048 }
00049 #endif
00050 //========================================================================
00051 // StartTimingCPU
00052 //
00053 // Call this function to start timing the CPU. It takes the CPU tick
00054 // count and the current time and stores it. Then, while you do other
00055 // things, and the OS task switches, the counters continue to count, and
00056 // when you call UpdateCPUTime, the measured speed is accurate.
00057 //
00058 //========================================================================
00059 int StartTimingCPU()
00060 {
00061         //
00062         // detect ability to get info
00063         //
00064         __asm
00065         {
00066                 pushfd                                  ; push extended flags
00067                 pop             eax                             ; store eflags into eax
00068                 mov             ebx, eax                ; save EBX for testing later
00069                 xor             eax, (1<<21)    ; switch bit 21
00070                 push    eax                             ; push eflags
00071                 popfd                                   ; pop them again
00072                 pushfd                                  ; push extended flags
00073                 pop             eax                             ; store eflags into eax
00074                 cmp             eax, ebx                ; see if bit 21 has changed
00075                 jz              no_cpuid                ; make sure it's now on
00076         }
00077 
00078         //
00079         // make ourselves high priority just for the time between
00080         // when we measure the time and the CPU ticks
00081         //
00082         DWORD dwPriorityClass = GetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess());
00083         int dwThreadPriority = GetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread());
00084         SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), REALTIME_PRIORITY_CLASS);
00085         SetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread(), THREAD_PRIORITY_TIME_CRITICAL);
00086 
00087         //
00088         // start timing
00089         //
00090         s_milliseconds0 = (int)timeGetTime();
00091 
00092         __asm
00093         {
00094                 lea             ecx, s_ticks0           ; get the offset
00095                 mov             dword ptr [ecx], 0      ; zero the memory
00096                 mov             dword ptr [ecx+4], 0    ;
00097                 rdtsc                                           ; read time-stamp counter
00098                 mov             [ecx], eax                      ; store the negative
00099                 mov             [ecx+4], edx            ; in the variable
00100         }
00101 
00102         //
00103         // restore thread priority
00104         //
00105         SetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread(), dwThreadPriority);
00106         SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), dwPriorityClass);
00107 
00108         return 0;
00109 
00110 no_cpuid:
00111         return -1;
00112 }
00113 
00114 //========================================================================
00115 // UpdateCPUTime
00116 //
00117 // This function stops timing the CPU by adjusting the timers to account
00118 // for the amount of elapsed time and the number of CPU cycles taked
00119 // during the timing period.
00120 //========================================================================
00121 void UpdateCPUTime()
00122 {
00123         //
00124         // make ourselves high priority just for the time between
00125         // when we measure the time and the CPU ticks
00126         //
00127         DWORD dwPriorityClass = GetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess());
00128         int dwThreadPriority = GetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread());
00129         SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), REALTIME_PRIORITY_CLASS);
00130         SetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread(), THREAD_PRIORITY_TIME_CRITICAL);
00131 
00132         //
00133         // get the times
00134         //
00135         s_milliseconds  = -s_milliseconds0;
00136         s_ticks                 = -s_ticks0;
00137 
00138         s_milliseconds  += (int)timeGetTime();
00139 
00140         __asm
00141         {
00142                 lea             ecx, s_ticks            ; get the offset
00143                 rdtsc                                           ; read time-stamp counter
00144                 add             [ecx], eax                      ; add the tick count
00145                 adc             [ecx+4], edx            ;
00146         }
00147 
00148         //
00149         // restore thread priority
00150         //
00151         SetThreadPriority(GetCurrentThread(), dwThreadPriority);
00152         SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), dwPriorityClass);
00153 
00154         return;
00155 }
00156 
00157 //========================================================================
00158 // CalcCPUSpeed
00159 //
00160 // This function takes the measured values and returns a speed that
00161 // represents a common possible CPU speed.
00162 //========================================================================
00163 int CalcCPUSpeed()
00164 {
00165         //
00166         // get the actual cpu speed in MHz, and
00167         // then find the one in the CPU speed list
00168         // that is closest
00169         //
00170         const struct tagCPUSPEEDS
00171         {
00172                 float   fSpeed;
00173                 int             iSpeed;
00174         } cpu_speeds[] =
00175         {
00176                 //
00177                 // valid CPU speeds that are not integrally divisible by
00178                 // 16.67 MHz
00179                 //
00180                 {  60.00f,       60 },
00181                 {  75.00f,       75 },
00182                 {  90.00f,       90 },
00183                 { 120.00f,      120 },
00184                 { 180.00f,      180 },
00185         };
00186 
00187         //
00188         // find the closest one
00189         //
00190         float   fSpeed=((float)s_ticks)/((float)s_milliseconds*1000.0f);
00191         int     iSpeed=cpu_speeds[0].iSpeed;
00192         float   fDiff=(float)fabs(fSpeed-cpu_speeds[0].fSpeed);
00193 
00194         for (int i=1 ; i<sizeof(cpu_speeds)/sizeof(cpu_speeds[0]) ; i++)
00195         {
00196                 float fTmpDiff = (float)fabs(fSpeed-cpu_speeds[i].fSpeed);
00197 
00198                 if (fTmpDiff < fDiff)
00199                 {
00200                         iSpeed=cpu_speeds[i].iSpeed;
00201                         fDiff=fTmpDiff;
00202                 }
00203         }
00204 
00205         //
00206         // now, calculate the nearest multiple of fIncr
00207         // speed
00208         //
00209 
00210         //
00211         // now, if the closest one is not within one incr, calculate
00212         // the nearest multiple of fIncr speed and see if that's
00213         // closer
00214         //
00215         const float fIncr=16.66666666666666666666667f;
00216         const int iIncr=4267; // fIncr << 8
00217 
00218         //if (fDiff > fIncr)
00219         {
00220                 //
00221                 // get the number of fIncr quantums the speed is
00222                 //
00223                 int     iQuantums       = (int)((fSpeed / fIncr) + 0.5f);
00224                 float   fQuantumSpeed   = (float)iQuantums * fIncr;
00225                 float   fTmpDiff        = (float)fabs(fQuantumSpeed - fSpeed);
00226 
00227                 if (fTmpDiff < fDiff)
00228                 {
00229                         iSpeed = (iQuantums * iIncr) >> 8;
00230                         fDiff=fTmpDiff;
00231                 }
00232         }
00233 
00234         return iSpeed;
00235 }
00236 
00237 
00238 //========================================================================
00239 // GetCPUSpeed
00240 //
00241 // Gets the CPU speed by timing it for 1 second.
00242 //========================================================================
00243 int GetCPUSpeed()
00244 {
00245         static int CPU_SPEED = 0;
00246 
00247         if(CPU_SPEED!=0)
00248         {
00249                 //This will assure that the 0.5 second delay happens only once
00250                 return CPU_SPEED;       
00251         }
00252 
00253         if (StartTimingCPU())
00254                 return 0;
00255 
00256         //This will lock the application for 1 second
00257         do
00258         {
00259                 UpdateCPUTime();
00260                 Sleep(SLEEPTIME);
00261         } while (s_milliseconds < 1000);
00262 
00263         CPU_SPEED = CalcCPUSpeed();
00264         return CPU_SPEED;
00265 }
